intro: Cephaelis timbiquensis, commonly known as the Timbiquí corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture. Cephaelis timbiquensis is often found in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests.
